dataset.title: Annual summaries of daily climatological observations from the National Weather Service weather station at Brunswick, Georgia for 1915 to 2004

abstract.para: Daily summaries of climatological observations from the National Weather Service weather station in Brunswick, Georgia, were obtained from the NOAA National Climatic Data Center (http://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/) covering the period 1915 through 2004. Missing values of daily minimum, maximum and mean temperature were estimated by cubic spline interpolation to fill in data gaps of five or fewer consecutive days. Annual summary statistics were then calculated for daily minimum, maximum and mean air temperature and total precipitation.

intellectualRights.para: All publications based on this data set must cite the contributor and Georgia Coastal Ecosystems LTER project, and two copies of the manuscript must be submitted to the GCE-LTER Information Management Office.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Overall bounding box describing the geographic region within the Georgia Coastal Ecosystems LTER study domain represented in data set MET-GCES-0508b, based on the maximum geographic extents of all site polygons referenced in the data set

section.title: Data Acquisition
section.para: Daily summary data were obtained from the NOAA National Climatic Data Center web site (http://www.ncdc.noaa.gov/) for the Brunswick Georgia National Weather Service station (COOP ID 091340) in delimited ASCII format. Data records were parsed from the ASCII file to create a tabular data set using the import filter 'imp_ncdc_climate' in the GCE Data Toolbox for MATLAB (http://gce-lter.marsci.uga.edu/lter/research/tools/data_toolbox.htm). Data set metadata were imported from a pre-defined metadata template for the station, and data values were validated and quality checked based on attribute metadata and quality control limit check and sanity check parameters defined in the template.

section.title: Data Processing
section.para: Imported data were processed using data management and statistical functions in the GCE Data Toolbox for MATLAB. Missing values of daily minimum, maximum and mean temperature were estimated by cubic spline interpolation to fill in data gaps of five or fewer consecutive days. Annual summary statistics were then calculated for daily minimum, maximum and mean air temperature and total precipitation by aggregating values based on year. Attribute metadata were automatically generated for each derived statistical parameter.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: GCE Study Site BRUNSWICK -- Brunswick, Brunswick, Georgia, USA. Brunswick is a city on the coast of Georgia, and this study site near the Intracoastal Waterway contains long-term climatological monitoring equipment operated by the National Weather Service (COOP ID 091340).

section.title: Statistical Analysis
section.para: Daily air temperature and precipitation data were collected from manual instruments housed in a weather station enclosure and transmitted to the National Weather Service. Data were subsequently acquired from the NOAA National Climate Database and statistically analyzed to provide annual summaries of air temperature and precipitation.

Missing values of daily minimum, maximum and mean temperature were estimated by cubic spline interpolation to fill in data gaps of five or fewer consecutive days. Annual summary statistics were then calculated for daily minimum, maximum and mean air temperature and total precipitation.

abstract.para: We propose to establish a Long Term Ecological Research site on the central Georgia coast in the vicinity of Sapelo Island. This is a barrier island and marsh complex with the Altamaha River, one of the largest and least developed rivers on the east coast of the US, as the primary source of fresh water. The proposed study would investigate the linkages between local and distant upland areas mediated by water - surface water and ground water - delivery to the coastal zone. We would explicitly examine the relationship between variability in environmental factors driven by river flow, primarily salinity because we can measure it at high frequency, and ecosystem processes and structure. We will accomplish this by comparing estuary/marsh complexes separated from the Altamaha River by one or two lagoonal estuary/marsh complexes that damp and attenuate the river signal. This spatial gradient is analogous to the temporal trend in riverine influence expected as a result of development in the watershed. We will implement a monitoring system that documents physical and biological variables and use the time trends and spatial distributions of these variables and of their variance structure to address questions about the factors controlling distributions, trophic structure, diversity, and biogeochemistry. An existing GIS-based hydrologic model will be modified to incorporate changes in river water resulting from changes in land use patterns that can be expected as the watershed develops. This model will be linked to ecosystem models and will serve as an heuristic and management tool. Another consequence of coastal development is that as river flow decreases, groundwater flow increases and becomes nutrified. We will compare the effects of ground water discharge from the surficial aquifer in relatively pristine (Sapelo Island) versus more urbanized (mainland) sites to assess the relative importance of fresh water versus nutrients to productivity, structure and biomass turnover rate in marshes influenced by groundwater. We will also investigate the effect of marine processes (tides, storm surge) on mixing across the fresh/salt interface in the surficial aquifer. Additional physical studies will relate the morphology of salt marsh - tidal creek channel complexes to tidal current distributions and exchange. These findings will be incorporated into a physical model that will be coupled to an existing ecosystem model. The land/ocean margin ecosystem lies at the interface between two ecosystems in which distinctly different groups of decomposers control organic matter degradation. The terrestrial ecosystem is largely dominated by fungal decomposers, while bacterial decomposers dominate the marine ecosystem. Both groups are important in salt marsh-dominated ecosystems. Specific studies will examine, at the level of individual cells and hyphae, the relationship bacteria and fungi in the consortia that decompose standing dead Spartina and other marsh plants and examine how, or if, this changes along the salinity gradient.

funding.para: This material is based upon work supported by the National Science Foundation under grant number OCE-9982133. Any opinions, findings, conclusions, or recommendations expressed in the material are those of the author(s) and do not necessarily reflect the views of the National Science Foundation.

description.para: Data file post-processing in the GCE-LTER Information Management Office

abstract.para: The GCE Data Toolbox is a comprehensive library of functions for metadata-based analysis, visualization, transformation and management of ecological data sets. The toolbox is based on the GCE Data Structure specification, a standard for storing tabular data along with all information required to interpret the data and generate formatted metadata (documentation). The various metadata fields in the structure are queried by toolbox functions for all operations, allowing functions to process and format values appropriately based on the type of information they represent. This semantic processing approach supports highly automated and intelligent data analysis and ensures data set validity throughout all processing steps.

description.para: 08/01/2005: new GCE Data Structure 1.1 created ('newstruct')
08/01/2005: 34146 rows imported from ASCII data file 'nws_brunswick_jan1895-mar2005_clean_filtered.txt' ('imp_ascii')
08/01/2005: 5 metadata fields in file header parsed ('parse_header')
08/01/2005: data descriptor metadata updated based on the template 'NCDC_Brunswick' ('meta_template')
08/01/2005: data structure validated ('gce_valid')
08/01/2005: Q/C flagging criteria applied, 'flags' field updated ('dataflag')
08/01/2005: automatically assigned study date metadata descriptors based on the range of date values in date/time columns (add_studydates)
08/01/2005: deleted column WBAN_Station_ID from the structure ('deletecols')
08/01/2005: converted units of 'Daily_Max_Temp_Air' column and 2 QA/QC flag criteria parameters from �F to �C ('ui_unitconv')
08/01/2005: converted units of 'Daily_Min_Temp_Air' column and 2 QA/QC flag criteria parameters from �F to �C ('ui_unitconv')
08/01/2005: converted units of 'Daily_Obs_Temp_Air' column and 2 QA/QC flag criteria parameters from �F to �C ('ui_unitconv')
08/01/2005: converted units of 'Daily_Mean_Temp_Air' column and 2 QA/QC flag criteria parameters from �F to �C ('ui_unitconv')
08/01/2005: converted units of 'Daily_Total_Precipitation' column and 2 QA/QC flag criteria parameters from inches to cm ('ui_unitconv')
08/01/2005: converted units of 'Daily_Snow_Fall' column and 1 QA/QC flag criteria parameters from inches to cm ('ui_unitconv')
08/01/2005: converted units of 'Daily_Snow_Depth' column and 1 QA/QC flag criteria parameters from inches to cm ('ui_unitconv')
08/01/2005: calculated serial date from individual date component columns, added 'Date' column at position 3 ('add_datecol')

08/01/2005: converted text codes in flag column(s) Flag_Daily_Total_Precipitation and Flag_Daily_Snow_Fall to QA/QC flags for data column(s) Daily_Total_Precipitation and Daily_Snow_Fall and deleted flag columns (cols2flags)

08/01/2005: inserted 6121 new records with date/time values and NaN/null data values (replicating common values in the non-data columns Coop_Station_ID and Provisional) to fill in date/time interval gaps in the data series ('fill_date_gaps')
08/01/2005: sorted by column Date(ascending) ('sortdata')
08/01/2005: deleted existing datetime columns Year, Month and Day; updated Year, Month, Day, Hour and Minute datetime columns added after column Date ('add_datepartcols')
08/01/2005: documented flagged and missing values as data set anomalies in the metadata ('add_anomalies')
08/01/2005: deleted columns Provisional, Cooling_Deg_Days, Heating_Deg_Days, Daily_Snow_Fall and Daily_Snow_Depth from data structure ('ui_editor')
08/01/2005: query 'Year>=1915 & Year<=2004' run, returned 32873 of 40267 data rows ('querydata')
08/01/2005: automatically assigned study date metadata descriptors based on the range of date values in date/time columns (add_studydates)
08/01/2005: deleted column Daily_Obs_Temp_Air from data structure ('ui_editor')

08/01/2005: filled in 211 missing values in column Daily_Max_Temp_Air with estimated values based on 1D interpolation of Daily_Max_Temp_Air as a function of Date using the 'spline' method, excluding data gaps with more than 5 consecutive missing values ('interp_missing')
08/01/2005: 211 values in 'Daily_Max_Temp_Air' were updated with new values ('update_data')
08/01/2005: Q/C flagging criteria applied, 'flags' field updated ('dataflag')

08/01/2005: filled in 191 missing values in column Daily_Min_Temp_Air with estimated values based on 1D interpolation of Daily_Min_Temp_Air as a function of Date using the 'spline' method, excluding data gaps with more than 5 consecutive missing values ('interp_missing')
08/01/2005: 191 values in 'Daily_Min_Temp_Air' were updated with new values ('update_data')
08/01/2005: Q/C flagging criteria applied, 'flags' field updated ('dataflag')

08/01/2005: filled in 250 missing values in column Daily_Mean_Temp_Air with estimated values based on 1D interpolation of Daily_Mean_Temp_Air as a function of Date using the 'spline' method, excluding data gaps with more than 5 consecutive missing values ('interp_missing')
08/01/2005: 250 values in 'Daily_Mean_Temp_Air' were updated with new values ('update_data')
08/01/2005: Q/C flagging criteria applied, 'flags' field updated ('dataflag')

08/01/2005: performed yearly statistical aggregation on data columns Daily_Max_Temp_Air, Daily_Min_Temp_Air, Daily_Mean_Temp_Air and Daily_Total_Precipitation by grouping on columns Coop_Station_ID and Year (aggr_datetime)
08/01/2005: updated title ('newtitle')
08/01/2005: updated 2 metadata fields in the Dataset, Status sections ('newtitle')
08/01/2005: calculated serial date from individual date component columns, added 'Date' column at position 2 ('add_datecol')

08/01/2005: documented flagged values in Yearly_Min_Daily_Max_Temp_Air, Yearly_Max_Daily_Max_Temp_Air, Yearly_Sum_Daily_Max_Temp_Air, Yearly_Mean_Daily_Max_Temp_Air, Yearly_StdDev_Daily_Max_Temp_Air, Yearly_SE_Daily_Max_Temp_Air, Yearly_Min_Daily_Min_Temp_Air, Yearly_Max_Daily_Min_Temp_Air, Yearly_Sum_Daily_Min_Temp_Air, Yearly_Mean_Daily_Min_Temp_Air, Yearly_StdDev_Daily_Min_Temp_Air, Yearly_SE_Daily_Min_Temp_Air, Yearly_Min_Daily_Mean_Temp_Air, Yearly_Max_Daily_Mean_Temp_Air, Yearly_Sum_Daily_Mean_Temp_Air, Yearly_Mean_Daily_Mean_Temp_Air, Yearly_StdDev_Daily_Mean_Temp_Air, Yearly_SE_Daily_Mean_Temp_Air, Yearly_Min_Daily_Total_Precipitation, Yearly_Max_Daily_Total_Precipitation, Yearly_Sum_Daily_Total_Precipitation, Yearly_Mean_Daily_Total_Precipitation, Yearly_StdDev_Daily_Total_Precipitation and Yearly_SE_Daily_Total_Precipitation as data set anomalies in the metadata ('add_anomalies')

08/01/2005: deleted columns Flagged_Daily_Max_Temp_Air, Yearly_Sum_Daily_Max_Temp_Air, Flagged_Daily_Min_Temp_Air, Yearly_Sum_Daily_Min_Temp_Air, Flagged_Daily_Mean_Temp_Air, Yearly_Sum_Daily_Mean_Temp_Air and Flagged_Daily_Total_Precipitation from data structure ('ui_editor')

08/01/2005: manually edited data set metadata ('ui_editmetadata')
08/01/2005: edited data set title in structure and metadata ('ui_editor')
08/01/2005: manually edited data set metadata ('ui_editmetadata')
08/01/2005: edited data set title in structure and metadata ('ui_editor')
08/01/2005: imported Dataset, Project, Site, Study, Status, Supplement metadata descriptors from the GCE Metabase ('imp_gcemetadata')
08/01/2005: updated 55 metadata fields in the Data, Dataset, Project, Site, Status, Study, Supplement sections ('imp_gcemetadata')
08/01/2005: manually edited data set metadata ('ui_editmetadata')
09/15/2005: imported Status metadata descriptors from the GCE Metabase ('imp_gcemetadata')

11/08/2005: imported Dataset, Project, Site, Study, Status, Supplement metadata descriptors from the GCE Metabase ('imp_gcemetadata')
11/08/2005: updated 67 metadata fields in the Data, Dataset, Project, Site, Status, Study, Supplement sections ('imp_gcemetadata')
04/17/2006: standardized case of date component column units to prevent unit conversion issues ('batch_update_datetime'): updated units for column Year from 'yyyy' to 'YYYY'
04/17/2006: updated 4 metadata fields ('addmeta')
04/17/2006: updated 15 metadata fields in the Status, Data sections to reflect attribute metadata ('updatecols')

04/17/2006: flags for columns Yearly_Min_Daily_Max_Temp_Air, Yearly_Max_Daily_Max_Temp_Air, Yearly_Mean_Daily_Max_Temp_Air, Yearly_StdDev_Daily_Max_Temp_Air, Yearly_SE_Daily_Max_Temp_Air, Yearly_Min_Daily_Min_Temp_Air, Yearly_Max_Daily_Min_Temp_Air, Yearly_Mean_Daily_Min_Temp_Air, Yearly_StdDev_Daily_Min_Temp_Air, Yearly_SE_Daily_Min_Temp_Air, Yearly_Min_Daily_Mean_Temp_Air, Yearly_Max_Daily_Mean_Temp_Air, Yearly_Mean_Daily_Mean_Temp_Air, Yearly_StdDev_Daily_Mean_Temp_Air, Yearly_SE_Daily_Mean_Temp_Air, Yearly_Min_Daily_Total_Precipitation, Yearly_Max_Daily_Total_Precipitation, Yearly_Sum_Daily_Total_Precipitation, Yearly_Mean_Daily_Total_Precipitation, Yearly_StdDev_Daily_Total_Precipitation and Yearly_SE_Daily_Total_Precipitation converted to data columns, flag codes updated in metadata ('flags2cols')

QA/QC flags are generated automatically according to domain criteria specified for each data column. A flag column is generated and appended to the data table if any flags are assigned to any value, listing the flags for each column on each row.
